titleStmt.title: Britain, or A chorographicall description of the most flourishing kingdomes, England, Scotland, and Ireland, and the ilands adjoyning, out of the depth of antiquitie beautified vvith mappes of the severall shires of England: vvritten first in Latine by William Camden Clarenceux K. of A. Translated newly into English by Philémon Holland Doctour in Physick: finally, revised, amended, and enlarged with sundry additions by the said author.
Britannia. English
titleStmt.author: Camden, William, 1551-1623.

titleStmt.title: Britain, or A chorographicall description of the most flourishing kingdomes, England, Scotland, and Ireland, and the ilands adjoyning, out of the depth of antiquitie beautified vvith mappes of the severall shires of England: vvritten first in Latine by William Camden Clarenceux K. of A. Translated newly into English by Philémon Holland Doctour in Physick: finally, revised, amended, and enlarged with sundry additions by the said author.
Britannia. English
titleStmt.author: Camden, William, 1551-1623.
Holland, Philemon, 1552-1637.

biblFull.extent: [16], 822, 233, [59] p., [50] plates, mostly folded : ill., maps

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by F. K[ingston] R. Y[oung] and I. L[egatt] for George Latham,

notesStmt.note: A translation of: Britannia. A variant of the editions with "A. Heb" (STC 4510), "Joyce Norton and R. Whitaker" (STC 4510.2), "A. Crooke" (STC 4510.4), or "W. Aspley" (STC 4510.6) in the imprint.
"Scotland" has a divisional title and separate pagination. Within this, "Ireland, and the smaller ilands in the British Ocean" has a divisional title; register is continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the University of Illinois (Urbana-Champaign Campus). Library.
